intro: Neobesseya roseiflora, commonly known as the pink-flowered neobesseya, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Queensland, Australia. It is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. Neobesseya roseiflora is often found growing in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
